items.title: ‚ÄúLimited time offer: a free support hour for your Xamarin project!
items.description: Are you running into problems with your project, or could you use some advice? At Xablu, we offer case-by-case support from topnotch developers. You can create a ticket for your issue, our developers will create tailored solutions and they will guide you through their work. No subscription or underlying costs: only pay for the support you need! Book your free hour of support now!‚Äù

items.title: GitHub is now free for teams
items.description:
Github has announced they are making private repositories with unlimited collaborators available to all GitHub accounts. All of the core GitHub features are now free for everyone. üéâ

GitHub is now free for teams by Nat Friedman
items.description_markdown:
Github has announced they are making private repositories with unlimited collaborators available to all GitHub accounts. All of the core GitHub features are now free for everyone. üéâ

[**GitHub is now free for teams**](https://github.blog/2020-04-14-github-is-now-free-for-teams/) by [Nat Friedman](https://github.com/nat)

items.title: Showcase of Xamarin Forms Student Projects
items.description:
XamGirl (Charlin Agramonte) has been teaching students Xamarin.Forms. As a final project, they had to create a new Xamarin Forms application using any open-source API. The results are very impressive!

Showcase of Xamarin Forms Student Projects by Charlin Agramonte
items.description_markdown:
XamGirl (Charlin Agramonte) has been teaching students Xamarin.Forms.  As a final project, they had to create a new Xamarin Forms application using any open-source API.  The results are very impressive!

[**Showcase of Xamarin Forms Student Projects**](https://xamgirl.com/showcase-of-xamarin-forms-student-projects/) by [Charlin Agramonte](https://twitter.com/Chard003)

items.title: Migrating ListView To CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms - Benefits
items.description:
Lists are a fundamental and inescapable part of mobile applications. Xamarin.Forms has both a ListView and the newer CollectionView. In this 3-part blog series, Matthew examines the benefits of collection views and how to migrate our existing list views to them.

Migrating ListView To CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms - Benefits by Matthew Robbins
items.description_markdown:
Lists are a fundamental and inescapable part of mobile applications. Xamarin.Forms has both a ListView and the newer CollectionView. In this 3-part blog series, Matthew examines the benefits of collection views and how to migrate our existing list views to them.

[**Migrating ListView To CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms - Benefits**](https://www.mfractor.com/blogs/news/migrating-listview-to-collectionview-in-xamarin-forms-benefits) by [Matthew Robbins]()

embedded_links.title: **Migrating ListView To CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms - Benefits**

items.title: On library versioning: Minimum version and AndroidX migration
items.description:
Last version of Sharpnado lib includes MaterialFrame with Acrylic mode, but also the compatibility with Xamarin.Forms 4.5 and AndroidX. Since version 4.5, Xamarin.Forms android platform dll is compiled against AndroidX when targeting Android 29 and Android.Support libs on others targets.

On library versioning: Minimum version and AndroidX migration by Jean-Marie Alfonsi
items.description_markdown:
Last version of Sharpnado lib includes MaterialFrame with Acrylic mode, but also the compatibility with Xamarin.Forms 4.5 and AndroidX. Since version 4.5, Xamarin.Forms android platform dll is compiled against AndroidX when targeting Android 29 and Android.Support libs on others targets.

[**On library versioning: Minimum version and AndroidX migration**](https://www.sharpnado.com/on-library-versioning/) by [Jean-Marie Alfonsi](https://www.sharpnado.com/author/roubachof/)

embedded_links.title: **On library versioning: Minimum version and AndroidX migration**

NOTE: Requires you to subscribe

items.title: Sync with the Cloud using Change Tracking API
items.description:
If you are creating a mobile app that will work sending data back and forth from the cloud (I guess that 99% of the apps fall into this use case), you will have at some point the need to sync data between the app and the cloud itself.

An amazingly simple solution for Mobile Apps to sync with the Cloud using Change Tracking API by Davide Mauri
items.description_markdown:
If you are creating a mobile app that will work sending data back and forth from the cloud (I guess that 99% of the apps fall into this use case), you will have at some point the need to sync data between the app and the cloud itself.

[**An amazingly simple solution for Mobile Apps to sync with the Cloud using Change Tracking API**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/azure-sql-change-tracking-data-sync/) by [Davide Mauri](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/author/damaurimicrosoft-com/)

embedded_links.title: **An amazingly simple solution for Mobile Apps to sync with the Cloud using Change Tracking API**

items.title: .NET Conf ‚Äì Focus on Xamarin Event Recap
items.description:
It is hard to believe that is has been nearly one month since .NET Conf ‚Äì Focus on Xamarin. This was our largest Xamarin live streaming event of the year with over nine hours of glorious Xamarin content from the Xamarin team and community.

.NET Conf ‚Äì Focus on Xamarin Event Recap by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
It is hard to believe that is has been nearly one month since .NET Conf ‚Äì Focus on Xamarin. This was our largest Xamarin live streaming event of the year with over nine hours of glorious Xamarin content from the Xamarin team and community.

[**.NET Conf ‚Äì Focus on Xamarin Event Recap**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/net-conf-focus-on-xamarin-event-recap/) by [James Montemagno](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/author/jamesmontemagno/)

embedded_links.title: **.NET Conf ‚Äì Focus on Xamarin Event Recap**

items.title: Logically Embed That Authentication
items.description:
Logically embed that authentication ... that doesn't make sense at all ... or does it? Well it does when James and Matt talk about Azure Logic Apps, embedded fonts, and the brand new Xamarin.Essentials authentication!

Logically Embed That Authentication by Xamarin
items.description_markdown:
